data.title: OBSERVATIONS
questions: In this phase, explore exactly what occurred.
What happened? What specifically did you observe/notice?
What else do you recall about it? What details?
How did you experience it? Any physical reactions?
What you think caused you to experience it that way?
What about the situation was unusual? Unexpected?

data.title: CONCERNS
questions: In this phase, delve into what concerned them about it.
How and what did you feel when it happened?
How are you feeling about it now?
How were your needs or concerns dealt with?
Which of your values or ethics came into play?
How did the event impact trust and/or relationship(s)?
What concerns do you have going forward?

data.title: MEANING
questions: In this phase, help the person understand what it means for her/him.
What about this was personally significant for you?
What are you inferring or assuming from what happened?
What are you telling yourself? How will you remember this?
What's your ‘gut’ tell you? What’s your take-away from this?
What’s important for you to remember going forward?

data.title: RESPONSE
questions: In this phase, help the person decide what to do about it.
What are your thoughts about responding?
What are the pros/cons of responding immediately?
What else do you need to know or do before responding?
What are your sources of power in this situation?
What do you need to communicate? Decide? Act on?
What first step do you need to take? When will you do that?
